items.text: good length outside off, clipped to long-on

items.preText: SunnyK: "West Indies have to surely think about only one thing mainly. reversing the order of the batting maybe. because there have been plenty of unnecessary experimentation being done at wrong times in wrong pitches with wrong lineups. I agree with one of the comments about the Captaincy, Holder was better and was good in all the formats, Its good to know Carlos is agile and has great observation but team.. should be supportive. Been waiting since ages to see Windies bounce back, but it never happens!"
items.text: good length on off, he stays back in his crease and guides it to point off an open face
off-cutter, but gets the line wrong and it ends up pitching on middle and going on to the pads. Tucked to square leg
another slower ball, but overpitched and he picks it off his toes to wide long-on
back of a length outside off, nipping in, pushed to cover
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Paul, no run

items.text: slower ball, gets it very full. The batsman adjusts to push it down to long-on
good yorker, but he gets his bat down in time to dig out towards point
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Hope, no run

items.preText: Malcolm : "This is one of the worst and most insipid batting displays I have seen in a while. Without Hope they would be 70 all out after 40 overs. Even worse is the fact that Bangladesh will come in and smash the runs in 25 overs or so." Too true. Insipid is the word, Hope apart
items.text: good length on off, he pushes it firmly to deep cover
fuller, angled across, he stays in his crease and stands tall to punch to deep cover
straighter, perhaps Keemo was expecting it to angle across. He certainly seemed late on his defensive block back to the bowler
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Paul, no run

items.text: back of a length on the stumps, pushed to short cover. They want a quick single, but Hope sends back Paul. But they get runs anyway because Mortaza has a shy at the batsman's stumps and the ball runs away to deep square leg
angled across and beats his forward poke
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Paul, no run

items.text: angled across but fuller, he punches to extra cover from outside off stump

items.preText: Craig: "WI best 11 right now had Bravo not been forced t retire wud have been: 1. Gayle 2. Hope 3. Hetmyer 4. Darren Bravo 5. Pooran (wk) 6. Russell 7. DJ Bravo (Capt) 8. Narine 9. Roach 10. Thomas 11. (Open for a good spinner)" - I wouldn't have Darren Bravo in there.
items.text: good length on middle, angling in. He goes on the back foot to work this to long-on
good length on the stumps again, turned towards midwicket. No one close in there and they can take the quick single
backed away and gave himself room, but only manages to toe-end this over the bowler's head with a horizontal swipe. Length ball outside off, he sends it to long-on
goes back and flicks this to fine leg

the stumps have gone for a walk keeps it full and straight, slower one nipping back in. Keemo went for an almighty swing of the bat, he was looking to hit it over long-off possibly. Ends up losing his stumps without getting a touch on the ball

dismissal.text: KMA Paul  b Mashrafe Mortaza 12 (22b 0x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

items.preText: James: "Scorecard looks like a case of Hope and hopeless." - Hah!
items.text: good length outside off, pushed to point's right
fuller on the stumps, Roach shows a straight bat while defending it
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Roach, no run

items.text: angled across, he helps it further by steering it to point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Roach, no run

items.text: back of a length on the stumps, doesn't rise too high though, but Roach is able to go back and clip it to midwicket
back of a length, angling across him, he stays in his crease and rises up to punch-steer it to point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: that moves appreciably. Off-cutter, slowed it down a touch, got Hope forward and prodding, but it zips past his outside edge, opening him up
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: keeps it straighter, and Hope is able to nudge it to mid-on for a quick single to retain strike
